00018         class EmitType;
00019 
00025         struct EmitTypeControl : public DeepMemoryPoolObject
00026         {
00027                 // Scripted behaviour
00028                 CodeRecord* code;
00029 
00030                 ScriptState state;
00031 
00032                 // Properties
00033                 struct Property
00034                 {
00035                         float time;
00036                         bstype speed;
00037                 };
00038 
00039                 Property properties[BS_MAX_PROPERTIES];
00040 
00041                 // Bitfield for properties set.  This limits the number of properties to 32, but this is
00042                 // an acceptable limitation.  In reality, the user can only define up to 
00043                 // BS_MAX_PROPERTIES properties, defined in bsConfig.h.
00044                 uint32 activeProperties; 
00045 
00046                 // Affectors.  These are stored as indices into a list of Affector instances, stored in
00047                 // the relevant EmitType.  For performance reasons, the maximum number of Affectors that an
00048                 // object can use is BS_MAX_EMITTER_AFFECTORS, defined in bsConfig.h.
00049                 int affectors[BS_MAX_EMITTER_AFFECTORS];
00050 
00051                 int numAffectors;
00052 
00053                 // Pointer to the EmitType that the object is a type of.
00054                 EmitType* __type;
00055 
00056                 // Pointer to the current object that owns this EmitTypeControl
00057                 UserTypeBase* __object;                 
00058 
00059                 // The index of the EmitterDefinition (stored in the ScriptMachine), used to index into
00060                 // the DeepMemoryPool that holds this instance.  EmitTypeControls are pooled per EmitterDefinition.
00061                 int __emitterDefinition;                
00062 
00063                 // Constructor.  This simply allocates enough memory for the local variables of the EmitterDefinition
00064                 // which will use it.  An EmitterDefinition will have a collection of states and functions, with a 
00065                 // varying number of locals for each.  Objects are controlled by functions, so we must make sure that
00066                 // the EmitTypeControl has enough space for the locals of any function in the EmitterDefinition.
00067                 
00068                 // Todo: this is inefficient in terms of memory.  It would save memory to count the maximum locals of
00069                 // states and functions separately and store those in the EmitterDefinition.
00070                 EmitTypeControl(int numLocals) :
00071                         DeepMemoryPoolObject(),
00072                         code(0),
00073                         activeProperties(0),
00074                         numAffectors(0),
00075                         __type(0),
00076                         __object(0),
00077                         __emitterDefinition(-1)
00078                 {
00079                         if (numLocals > 0)
00080                                 state.locals = new bstype[numLocals];
00081                 }
00082 
00083                 // Desstructor.  Destroy local variable array.
00084                 ~EmitTypeControl()
00085                 {
00086                         delete[] state.locals;
00087                 }
00088         };
00089 
00090         class ScriptMachine;
00091         class TypeManager;
00092 
00098         class _BSAPI EmitType

00109

00112                 {
00113                         String name;

00115                         GetFunction getter;
00116

00118                 };

00128

00130                 // control of it.
00131                 int mType;
00132
